did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Usually French photographers of French Africa. Three different accessions purchased from same dealer, although previous provenance is mixed. Some cards are written on; some not. Accession 1995-244 is in box 1, and consists of one album and 26 folders totaling some 500 cards. The photographers listed as added entries can all be found in this accession. Accession 2000-238 is in box 2 (Senegal, some 197 loose cards in folders) and in box 3 (album of ca. 300 cards of French West Africa, French Equatorial Africa, North Africa, Madagasca, Aden, Somali Coast, Union of South Africa, Zanaibar, etc.). Accession 2000-276 is also in box 3 and consists of an album of ca. 300 cards that are largely sub-Saharan Africa, mostly from former French colonies and the Belgian Congo, but also some from North Africa, Union of South Africa, and a scattering of other British-controlled territories. Approximately 90% of these were issued before 1940.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Colonial Africa: Postcard Collection. M0814. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Usually French photographers of French Africa. Three different accessions purchased from same dealer, although previous provenance is mixed. Some cards are written on; some not. Accession 1995-244 is in box 1, and consists of one album and 26 folders totaling some 500 cards. The photographers listed as added entries can all be found in this accession. Accession 2000-238 is in box 2 (Senegal, some 197 loose cards in folders) and in box 3 (album of ca. 300 cards of French West Africa, French Equatorial Africa, North Africa, Madagasca, Aden, Somali Coast, Union of South Africa, Zanaibar, etc.). Accession 2000-276 is also in box 3 and consists of an album of ca. 300 cards that are largely sub-Saharan Africa, mostly from former French colonies and the Belgian Congo, but also some from North Africa, Union of South Africa, and a scattering of other British-controlled territories. Approximately 90% of these were issued before 1940.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.corpname: A. Pleux et Truchi, edit., Fez.
Anciens Etab. Neurdein et Cie., Paris.
L'Oeuvre de la Propagation de la Foi, Paris.

scopecontent.p: Contains images of women, children, and men in the Algiers Casbah in the first part of the 20th century, taken on the following streets: rue de la Mer Rouge; rue N'Fissa; rue Ben Ali; rue Sidi Abdaleh; Impasse Kleber. Includes one image of women weaving, several of men conversing in the streets, and several of veiled women.

Contains images of Algiers, including scenes from the Casbah, women, men and children, and street scenes of the following streets: rue Marengo; rue de la Mer Rouge; Rue d'Isly; Rue Bab Azoun; rue de la Liberte; rue Michelet; les Cinq Avenues and rue de Constantine; Boulevard Amiral-Pierre; rue Sadi-Carnot. Contains images of the following buildings; Au Bon Marche; Hotel Excelsoir; Hotel de la Regence; le Marche de la Lyre,

Contains postcards with images of various buildings and street scenes in Algiers and Mustapha. Images include: la place de la Republique; le Theatre municipal, Square Bresson; la Prefecture; le Musee; rue Dumont-d'Urville; le nouvel Hotel des Postes; le Lycee (Bugeaud); Avenue Bab-el-Oued. From Mustapha, images of the Arsenal d'Artillerie; Alexandra Hotel; Hotel Kirsch; Quartier Julienne.

Contains images from the Port of Algiers. One postcard depicts an historical engraving of port and pier. Other images include: le Palais consulaire; les rampes; the railroad station; l'escalier de la pecherie; le Boulevard de la Republique; le Boulevard Carnot. Identified commercial buildings include: Imprimerie Jourdan; Hangars et Abris de la Chambre de Commerce; Ch. Schiaffino; A. Jouvet & Cie; L. Bergeret Fils; Vins A. Bonneville; A. Morris Minieri.

Contains images of various mosques and other islamic religious buildings in Algiers. Includes images of Mosque Djamaa Djedid, la Grande Mosquee (El Kebir Mosque); the Medersa; Tombeau de la Reine; Mosquee de Sidi Abderhaman. Also images of la Place du Gouvernement; Statue du Duc d'Orleans; rue de la Marine.

did.unittitle: Governor's palaces and Christian religious buildingsn.d. (1900-1945)

scopecontent.p: Contains postcards of the Palais d'ete du Gouverneur (Mustapha); Palais d'ete du Gouverneur (Algiers). Also contains images of Christian religious buildings in Algiers: the Cathedral and Notre-Dame d'Afrique.

controlaccess.corpname: Edition L. & Y., Alger L.L.ND Phot
controlaccess.subject: Algeria, Description and travel
Architecture, colonial
Basilicas
Cathedrals
Colonial cities
Religious buildings

scopecontent.p: Contains postcards of the following towns: Arzew, Bone, Bou-Saada, Cherchell. Includes images of a covered market (Arzew); the port (Arzew); of street scenes (Bone; Cherchell); and the departure for the races (Bou-Saada).

Contains postcards from Biskra. Includes images of the Mosquee de Sidi-Mouna; le Fumoir du Chateau Landon; Hotel du Sahara. Images of la Rue Berthe, le Cercle Militaire; Rue des Ouled-Nails; la Grande Allee; la place du Marche. Also 2 postcards with images of caravans, 1 postcard of the Sahara desert.
Contains postcards from Blida. Includes images of the Place du Marche, the Place d'Alger, the Kiosque of the Place Georges Clemenceau, Gorges de la Chiffa.

Contains postcards from the towns of Constantine and Philippeville. The six postcards of Constantine contain images of the Gorges du Rummel, the Square de la Republique, two views taken from the Camp des Oliviers and the Route de Mansourah, and the Palais de la Justice. The two postcards of Philippeville both contain images of the Place de la Marine.
Contains 3 postcards of the Roman ruins at Djemila. Includes images of "Le Grand Temple" and "Arc du Grand Cardo."
Contains 1 postcard of the Grand Pavillon de l'Etablissement at Hammam-Meskoutine. 1 postcard of the forest at Hammam-R'hira.
Contains 3 postcards with images from the Kabylia region. Includes: Le Col de Tirourda; Yakouren; Tizi-Ouzou.
Contains 4 postcards from El Kantara. Includes images of the oasis, of the railroad station, of the Gorges d'El-Kantara, and of the Pont du Diable.

controlaccess.corpname: Soeurs Miissionaires de N.-D. d'Afrique, Alger
controlaccess.subject: Algeria, Description and travel
Gorges
Oases
Railroad stations

scopecontent.p: Contains images of Laghouat. Includes one series of 14 postcards from Seddik, Musée de l'Oasis, Laghouat. These contain the following images: General views, the church, the Hotel Transatlantique, Porte de la Seguia, Place du Chameau and Public gardens, Schetett street, the mosque, the Marabout of Sidi Abd-el-Kader, Quartier des Ouled-Nails, Avenue Marguerite, the Hospital. Includes 3 postcards from the Coll. Hotel Saharien, Aracil, Laghouat. These contain images of The Place du Barail, le Lavoir des Negresses, Grand Hotel Saharien. Two other images: the Mosque and the Marabout des Ouled-Aissa ben Ali.

Contains postcards from diverse towns. The images are as follows: Maison Carree: Market, Meknes: ruins of Volubilis, Mers-el-Keber: view of the fort, panoramic view, Moliere: Mosque, M'sila: sunrise over oasis

Contains images of the city of Oran, including a view of the Fort Saint-Philippe, Promenade de l'Etang, the Theater, Route des Planteurs, the port, Grand Hotel d'Oran, Place Kleber and the Prefecture, a scene entitled "Fantasia au village negre."
Contains four postcards from the same series. Three show the Gorges de Palestro, the fourth shows a hut in the Arab market with its owner.

Contains postcards from various towns in the Saharan Desert, as follows: Ghardaia: Caravan, market, "Fantasia sur la Grande Place, El Golea: panoramic view, Sahara algerien: African women making bread, In-Guettara: gorges, Figuig: Village d'El Mais, road scene
These four postcards contain the following images: Hotel de Ville and Portes d'Alger, Marche Arabe, Post Office, Mosque
Contains the following images: Sidi-Bel-Abbes: Public Gardens, Marabout, Sidi-Bou-Medine: panoramic view, Sidi-Okba: La Grande Place, the Market
Postcards of Tebessa, including a view taken from the Route de Zouira and the ramparts of the Byzantine citadel.

Timgad contains a major site of Roman ruins. The CAP series of 22 postcards contains the following images, (some duplicates): Arc of Trajan; Amphitheater, Columns for Pronaos du Capitole; Byzantine baptistery; Market; Gardens; Forum; Boutiques in the Sirtius market; Temple of Genie; Roman baths and mosaics. The ND Phot series of 6 postcards contains views of: Gardens; columns; the theater, the baths; mosaics. Collection Ideale PS: Hemicycle of Macellum.
Contains the following images: Ruins of the Fortress of Toubiana; Tower of Mansourah; Oued-Mefrouch-el-Ourit Waterfall; Mosque of Sidi-Bou-Medine; Ruins of Sidi-Yacoub.
One image of Ouled-Nail women sitting before their tents; one image of the Grande Place at Touggourt.

Various postcards showing Algerian individuals or groups, either presented as an archetype, or as an example of a traditional occupation. Also includes some street scenes and desert scenes, and examples of indigenous housing. Images include: Mauresques and Maures, Mozabite man, women washing, the firewood market, the Constantine Phosphate company, a caravan, Kabyle and Arab huts, and a historical painting of fighting at Sig.

This folder contains 6 postcards from Aden. These have images of city, the water tanks, the fruit market, Steamer Point, and a caravan. One postcard from Saudi Arabia pictures a mosque. One picture from Persia shows a grouping of people around a patriarch for a festival.

controlaccess.corpname: Seyed Abdor Rahime Tachani, Teheran, Persia
controlaccess.subject: Aden, Description and Travel
Harbors

scopecontent.p: The 9 postcards of British East Africa include the following images: a shepherd, Arab architecture, a view from Nairobi Hill, a native village, and hunting and animal scenes. The 4 postcards from Zanzibar includean image of the Beit-el-Ajaib (the house of wonders), the Ladies' Club and Jubilee Garden, the Country Palace of the Sultan, and Dhow Harbour. One postcard from the Freres Blancs, Uganda, of Missionaries hunting. One postcard of Mt. Kibo, Tanganyika.

Standard P. & P. Works, British East Africa

scopecontent.p: 2 postcards from Nigeria: a water seller, cliffs on coast outside of Lagos 2 postcards from Ghana: the General Post Office and Kano City

This folder contains 37 postcards with images of the Belgian Congo (1908-1960). Included are postcards from the towns of: Boko, Boma, Bukama, Elisabethville, Kafubu, Chutes Ki-Oubo, Matadi, Kivu, Remondville, Stanleyville. Postcards depicting fishing in the Upper Congo, on the Tanganiki, a marketplace, elephants in the river at Also Postcards of people working: "un corps de balais" (women sweeping, a pun on corps de ballet), a rice plantation, hair-stylists. Postcard of a tribal chief and his many wives. Postcards showing colonial power: hunting, military posts, colonial forces of order. Postcards showing missionary work. 3 postcards printed by Belgian marine interests.

did.unittitle: Africa, French speaking equatorial including Lower and Middle Congo, Chad, Cameroonn.d. (1900-1960)

scopecontent.p: This folder contains postcards from the area formerly known as Congo (Brazzaville) or French Equatorial Africa. 17 postcards of Brazzaville: Institut Pasteur, le Relais Hotel, Jardins de la Residence, Catholic Mission and Cathedral, Catholic procession, View from Route de la Corniche (Belgian Congo), Djoue riverbank, Congo riverbank, bridge over M'Foa, fishermen and flottila, Woman from Brazzaville. 1 postcard of the railroad of Matadi, Compagnie Francaise du Haut-Congo. 1 postcard of caravan with missionaries 1 postcard of small tugboat on river 1 postcard of Tirailleurs senegalais 1 postcard of a monument to Colonel de Roux, Bangui 1 postcard of Danse goran, Chad 2 postcards, indigenous art, French Cameroon

controlaccess.corpname: Missions des Pretres du Sacre-Coeur de St Quentin

scopecontent.p: 4 postcards from Cote d'Ivoire: Embarcation of mahogany in Grand Lahou Pushing the tiller, Grand Lahou Village devastated by Samory (the Black Napoleon) in 1898, A river in the forest
8 postcards from Dahomey. Cotonou: Monument for soldiers, Market, Grand Popo, Ouida: village, Porto-Novo: bridge, river, Fishing village, Prince's wedding
5 postcards from Djibouti: Place Menelik, the Hospital, La Rue d'Abyssinie, Post office, Somali children

controlaccess.corpname: "Au Cafe de la Paix", Djibouti, Editeur "Au Bon Marche", Djibouti, J-G. Mody, photographe
controlaccess.subject: Djibouti
Hospitals

scopecontent.p: This folder contains 14 postcards of Alexandria. Street scenes include Boulevard d'Allemagne, Rue de la Poste. Images of the sea and canals include the Metropole Hotel, Glymenopoulo Beach, and 2 postcards of the Canal Mahmoudieh. Images also include the Moustapha Pacha Barracks, the Nabi Daniel Mosque, the Public Abbatoirs, the Public Gardens, Pompey's Pillar. Images from Ramleh include the Ramleh train station and a scene of Europeans riding horses in front of palm trees.

This folder contains postcards with images of Cairo and of the Giza pyramids. Includes the following images from Cairo streets: panoramic views, the inside of a house, the university, and the Grand Cafe Chicha. 12 postcards of mosques, the Citadel, and tombs: Mohamed Ali mosque, Kait Bey mosque, Sultan Hassan mosque, Alabaster mosque, tombs of Mamelouks, tombs of caliphs. 9 postcards of pyramids at Giza: Sphinx with camel driver in foreground, Great Pyramid of Chefren, Kafr-el-Haram, views at sunset. 2 postcards of bedouin camps.

controlaccess.corpname: Au Cartosport Max H. Rudmann, Cairo

Forts and fortifications

Pyramids, Egypt

scopecontent.p: 4 postcards of Heliopolis, including 2 of the Palace Hotel, and 2 street scenes of the Boulevard Abbas.

did.unittitle: Subsubseries 4. Nile and Cities on the Nile
Nile and cities of Aswan, Karnak, Luxor, Memphis

scopecontent.p: 11 postcards of the Nile River and of the cities along the Nile.Includes boats on Nile. Aswan: the Savoy Hotel. the Ferry, Granite quarries. Bedrechin: palm grove Karnak: Avenue of Sphinxes, Pylon of Eugerte. Luxor: Temple and Statue of Ramses, Pigeon Tower of Goornah, Memphis: Alabaster sphinx

The 21 postcards in this folder contain the following: Views of Port Said, the statue of De Lessepsin Lesseps Square, views of the harbor and port, the Quai Francois Joseph and the Agence des Messageries Maritimes, the lighthouse, the entry to the canal. the Suez Canal office, the Casino, street scenes.

did.unittitle: Port Said, postcards published by the Oriental Commercial Bureaun.d.

scopecontent.p: These postcards represent an incomplete numbered set of images of Port Said published by the Oriental Commercial Bureau, Port Said, Egypt. Images include: De Lesseps Statue, the Harbor, the beach, the lighthouse, quai Sultan Hussein, the Canal Company's offices, Prince Farouk Street, Boulevard Fouad I, Avenue Eugenie, view of Arab quarter.

did.unittitle: Port Said, postcards published by Lehnert & Landrockn.d.

scopecontent.p: An incomplete set of 10 numbered colored postcards of Port Said. Images include: De Lesseps Statue, the Harbor, the Suez Canal, the Casino, Boulevard Fouad I, the Abbes Mosque, the Arab quarter, the beach (the 'Strand'). 6 b & w postcards also published by Lehnert & Landrock. Images include: the port, the lighthouse, De Lesseps Statue, offices of the Suez Canal Company, Prince Farouk Street, the Suez Canal.

did.unittitle: Port Said, postcards published by Isaac Behar, Port Saidn.d.

scopecontent.p: 12 numbered color postcards of Port Said published by Isaac Behar. Images include: De Lesseps Statue, the Harbor, the Suez Canal, the Palais des Hollandais, the offices of the Suez Canal Company, boats in the canal, the beach, the English Church and convent of Bon-Pasteur, the Marina and lighthouse.

did.unittitle: Suez Canal and cities on the Canal except Port Saidn.d.

scopecontent.p: This folder contains postcards of the Suez Canal itself and of cities on the canal. Ismailia: floodgate, Lake Timsah, El-Kantara: crossing of the Suez Canal, Suez: views of city, Colmar Street, Port Tewfik: views of port, end of Suez Canal, mosque

scopecontent.p: Three postcards of Gabon. Two are of the beach at Libreville. One shows an old blind man with a child guiding him.
Three postcards of Gabon. Two are of the beach at Libreville. One shows an old blind man with a child guiding him.

8 postcards from German East Africa. Views include the following: 3 postcards of Mariannhill showing indigenous dwellings. 1 postcard with a color photograph of the church in Moschi, German East Africa. 2 scenes of villages in Tanga. 2 sketches of the tropics.

controlaccess.corpname: Verlag des Evang.-luth, Mission zu Leipzig
controlaccess.subject: Beaches
Churches
German East Africa, Description and travel
Villages

scopecontent.p: 13 postcards from Guinea, West Africa. Includes 11 postcards with images from the city of Conakry: The "Ballay" Monument, the entrance to the city, the Boulevard Circulaire and the Cie. Commerciale d'Exportation, the Chateau d'Eau, the Mission Charles Morel, the celebration of Ramadan, and three identitcal postcards showing the waterfront with the phrase "Visitez l'Afrique occidentale francaise a l'Exposition coloniale de Paris, 1931." 1 postcard of a street in Kankan. One postcard showing the Minister of the Colonies on a voyage at the Tabili railroad station.
5 postcards of Lesotho (Lessouto). Indigenous houses in a cave at Qalo, schoolteacher's family, the mission school at Thabana-Morena, a chief's wife at Thaba-Bosiu.
9 postcards of Tripoli, Libya. Scenes include panoramic views of the city taken from the water, the Governor's Palace, rue Azizie, the military barracks, street and market scenes, and il Castello.

15 postcards of cities and towns in Madagascar. Tananarive: Antaninarena - Ambatonakanga; Analakey - Avenue Falliere and the train station; Governor General Residence and Park; Queen's Palace; Garden of the Prime Minister's Tomb; Andohalo Cathedral; Indigenous Hospital of Befelantanana; Temple of Ambochipotay. Diego-Suarez: Cap Diego; Administrator's Residence; Roussette Waterfall. Other cities: Covered market; Nossi-be - indigenous theater; Majunga - autos

controlaccess.corpname: Couadou, phot., Toulon-sur-Mer, Editeurs Grand Bazar, Charifou Jeewa, Edition Cassam-Chenai, Diego-Suarez, Etablissements Rene Depui, Edit., Imprimerie E. Bachel, Tamatave, Photo Goulamhoussen Charifou fils, Diego-Suarez
controlaccess.subject: Architecture, colonial
Hospitals
Madagascar, Description and travel
Markets
Panoramic views
Waterfalls

scopecontent.p: 11 postcards of Madagascar. 3 postcards of scenes of boats, the sea, and rivers. 8 postcards with images of people: women water carriers, rice workers, schoolchildren bathing, meal at a school, and nurses and the school at the leper colony at Manankavaly.

Fourteen postcards of Casablanca, Morocco. Images include the following: Banque d'Etat au Maroc; Barracks of the 1er Zoaves; Stock Exchange; Prefecture and Palais de Justice; Parc Lyautey; Marketplace; Arcades of the Nouvelle Kassaria; Slaughterhouse; Place de France; Porte de Marrakech; Rue de l'Horloge; cargo ship Volubilis in harbor; harbor scenes.

Thirteen postcards of Tangiers, Morocco. Images include the following: Panoramic views and street scenes of Tangiers; Cabo Espartel; the beach; Sidi-Bou-Aabaid Mosque; Mosque of the Aissaouas; Casbah; Legation de France; Place de France and Boulevard Pasteur; Boulevard de la Plage and Hotel Cecil; the Charf.

controlaccess.corpname: A. Arevalo, Libreria Espanola y Extrajera, Tangiers

Casbah

did.unittitle: Subsubseries 3. Cities Except Casablanca and Tangiers
Fez; Itzer; Marrakech; Mazagan; Oudjda; Rabat;Safi; Tetuann.d.

scopecontent.p: 17 postcards of several towns and cities in Morocco. Fez: Panoramic view; indigenous brick oven; Nidjaraine visit; Arab story tellers; Marabout Si-Ahmed-Tijani. Itzer: Main Entrance to city, Marrakech: La Menara; Gueliz Fort; Avenue de la Koutoubia, Mazagan: Portuguese monument; Interior of Camp Requiston, Oudjda: Casbah guarded by Spahis; panoramic view, Rabat: Ruins of the Chellah; Ouidaia and old ramparts; Safi: Bab Chabah; Tetuan: Fortifications

scopecontent.p: 14 postcards of Moroccan people and leaders. 5 show images of the Sultan, his family, or his ministersSultan's sons on pilgrimage to Moulay-Idriss; Sultan in Tangiers; Arrival of Mouley Arafa, Sultan's uncle, receiving William II in Tangiers; Sultan visiting the Agricultural Exposition; Manebhi, Minister of War; 9 depict images of Moroccans, including grain merchants, camps of nomads, children, a marabout in the oasis, street scenes, military camp

scopecontent.p: 50 postcards, including many duplicates, of Dakar, Senegal. Images include: panoramic views of the city, the Court; Boulevard National; Place Protet; the Town Hall; the Town Hall gardens; the Government building (Palais du Gouvernement); Anse Bernard.

64 postcards of Dakar, Senegal. Images include: Hotel de la Marine; Post Office, TSF; Monument Blanchet; Round-about between the Ecole and the Avenue Pasteur; Tourist office; Medical school; Government buildings; Museum of French West Africa; Train station; marketplace; the Port and the Palais du Port; Senegalese fishermen and boats; Casernes des Madeleines; Bay of the Madeleines; military camps;

39 postcards of Dakar, Senegal, mostly street scenes. Many duplicates. Images include: the Mosque; the Church; the Public Garden; Place Protet; rue des Essarts; Boulevard National; rue Parent; General Secretary; Boulevard Pinet-Laprade; Boulevard Maritime; Avenue Roume; rue Raffenel; rue de Thies; rue Vincens.
23 postcards of Dakar, Senegal, and its environs. Images include: the indigenous village,;families and children; the oasis and garden of Hann; another (?) oasis near Dakar; and Cap Manuel.

did.unittitle: Rochers de Billy; Ile de Goree; Kayes; Makana; Ngazobit; Rufisque; Saint-Louisn.d.

scopecontent.p: 33 postcards of towns and rural areas in Senegal. Images include the following: Rochers de Billy, Haut-Senegal; Ile de Goree: various views; Place principale; Place du Gouvernement; la Terrasse. Many duplicates. Kayes: Hotel du Gouvernement; Makana: road outside town; Ngazobit: cliffs nearby; Rufisque: panoramic views; indigenous village; Maisons Soucail and L. Vezia & Co.; Compagnie Francaise de l'Afrique Occidentale; covered peanut storage; Shipping of grain; radio antenna; Saint-Louis: panoramic view; caravan; quarter of fishermen; Avenue Dodds; Allee des cocotiers

controlaccess.corpname: Edition de l'Ecole Apostolique Lierre, Belgium
controlaccess.subject: Agriculture
Architecture, colonial
Caravans
Cliffs
Colonial power

Harbors

Senegal, Description and travel
Street scenes
Villages

scopecontent.p: 33 postcards of people, villages, and landscape in Senegal. The first two postcards are notable for the poems written on them by a French man to a woman in France. Others include images of the following subjects: girls spinning cotton; groups of boys, women, children; women drawing water from well; mission school; fighters; village scenes; mosque; fishing boats on river and fishernen's houses; caravan carrying salt; harvest of palm wine; oases

25 postcards of Freetown, Sierra Leone, and its environs. Images include the following: Views of Freetown; Victoria Park; Custom's Offices; Tower Hill barracks; Commissariat; Wilberforce Station; Wilberforce Street; Westmoreland street; Susan's Bay (also known as Sawpit Bay); wharf and harbor; Leicester Hill; Waterfalls; villages; a woman "making Furrah"

did.unittitle: Boulam; Charlotte Falls; Congo Town; Hammock River Bridge; Songo; Waterloo; York Islandn.d.

scopecontent.p: 12 postcards of villages and rural areas in Sierra Leone, excluding Freetown. Images are as follows: Boulam: village scenes; Charlotte Falls; Congo Town: two views near Congo Town; Hammock River Bridge: the bridge; Songo Town; Waterloo: village scene; York Island: view of village and persons, two postcards of river scenes

10 postcards of the former French military territory of Soudan, present-day Mali and part of Mauritania. Images include the following towns and sites: Bamako: Monument to tirailleurs soudanais, Djenne: village, boat; Koulikoro: military post, Tahoua: military post, tribal chiefs; Tomboctou: mosque, view; views by bodies of water

13 postcards depicting Cape Town, South Africa. Images include the following: views of city with Table Mountain in background; Devil's Peak; Lion's Head; Grand Parade and City Hall; Houses of Parliament; Castle; St. George's Cathedral; harbor; Van Riebeeck statue; Adderly Street; Standard Bank

controlaccess.corpname: The Newman Art Publishing Co., Cape Town
The Valentine & Sons Publishing Co., Cape Town

did.unittitle: Bloemfontein; Durban; Johannesburg; Rondebosch; Valley of a Thousand Hills; Victoria Fallsn.d.

scopecontent.p: 17 postcards of towns and sites in South Africa. Of special note: a series of "ricksha boys" in Durban. Images on these postcards include the following subjects: Bloemfontein: Railway station, Durban: Post office; Town Hall; Ricksha boys (6 postcards); Johannesburg: King George's Street; gold mines; art gallery; Rondesbosch: rural estate, Valley of a Thousand Hills, Natal: 2 views, Victoria Falls: 2 views of bridge

scopecontent.p: 19 postcards from South Africa. Of these, 6 depict images of people, including a mother and her child, an old man; groups of people sitting outside of a hut; and a stone structure. The rest contain pictures of animals, including: Impala; Zebra; Giraffe; Kudu; Sable; Rhinoceros; Antelope; blue Wildebeest; Lion; Elephant; Bull Sealion; Penguins; Ostrich; Termite mound. These images are located at Kruger National Park; Drakensberg National Park, Natal; Mossel Bay, Cape Province; Dyer's Island, Cape Agulhas.

Images include the following: Khartoum: Palace and gardens; Gordon College; Parliament Building; Grand Hotel; Khedive Ave.; Blue Nile and Blue Nile Bridge; White Nile Bridge; Port Sudan: views of town; Mosque; Public garden; Wadi-Halfa: River view; street scene, Market, People: Battaheen Arabs; Man; Children

scopecontent.p: 3 postcards from Togo. 2 similar with image of beach and oil rigs. One of Beach Anecho

These 28 postcards contain the following images of Tunis: Grande Mosque; marabout; artisanal boutiques; a cafe; prisoners wearing chains; Lycee Carnot; Cathedral; Palace of Justice; Post office, Marketplaces: Souk El Sekadjine (saddle-makers); Arab market; Arab coal market; Souk des Femmes; Souk El Attarine. Street scenes include: rue Sidi Ben Arous; rue des Etoffes; rue et Place Bab-Souika; rue Sidi ben Ziad; Ave. Jules Ferry; Le Square de la Residence; Place Anatole France, Avenue de Paris; Avenue Theodore Roustan; Rue du Pacha; Place des Selliers.

scopecontent.p: Postcards with images of children, mainly of North Africa and subsaharan Africa. Of note: some of the postcards seem to show erotic or homoerotic images. One postcard shows a young girl lying down with a sign in front of her wishing "Happy New Year, 1913"

Arabs

scopecontent.p: Postcards showing various views and activities in the Sahara Desert. Organized according to the following themes: dunes; caravans and camels; oeuds (springs in the desert); oasis; palm forests (palmeraies); seguias (desert rivers); marabouts
Four postcards showing various "food scenes" in North Africa. Images include: Women making couscous; a "cafe maure"; a "cafe arabe"; an Arab restaurant

These postcards contain both "typical" images of men and images depicting various occupations. Most are from North Africa and Egypt. Images include: African warrior; an Arab sheik; rural Arabs; water porters from the M'zab and elsewhere; Sais; Arab merchants; lemonade sellers; donkey boys; olive oil mill; farmer; snake keepers; camel keepers; goat herders.

scopecontent.p: These postcards were all published by missionary orders. Some depict the missionary work itself, while others show the terrain. From L'Oeuvre de la Propagation de la Foi: in the Canadian north; 2 young Eskimos; Hospital of the Soeurs de St-Joseph de l'Apparition in Mateur, Tunisia; Soeurs Bleues de Castres, Libreville, Congo; young Christian couples, Congo; meeting of 2 missionaries, Madagascar; class in orphanage, Asia; catechism, Oceania. Other images include: "virgin forest"; Mhonda waterfalls; coconut trees; travelling nuns; travelling missionaries; church in the wilderness.

controlaccess.corpname: Congregation des Filles de la Croix de Liege
L'Oeuvre de la Propagation de la Foi, Paris
controlaccess.subject: Indigenous peoples
Missionaries
Religious

scopecontent.p: These postcards depict religious rituals, primarily in North Africa. Images include the following: crowds praying in the desert; evening prayers; solitary prayer in the desert; reading of the Koran; mosques; marabout (religious person) in the oasis; funeral rites.

These postcards depict women, individual or in groups, apparently with the intent of showing the exoticness of Arab and African women. Many images of veiled women, or of women in stages of undress. Also images of urban indigenous women in European dress. Several photos also depict women working - washing, grinding grain; dancing; cooking; and farming.

controlaccess.corpname: Congregation des Filles de la Croix de Liege
ND Phot. Neurdein et Cie., Paris
controlaccess.subject: Arab women
Women
Families

scopecontent.p: These 6 postcards show scenes of Europe (Belgium, England, France, Germany, Spain). Two especially are of interest: One showing a procession of Arab or South Asian men parading on horseback down a street that apppears to be in Europe (Paris?); one of a Somali mother and child on exhibit in a park in Germany.

did.unittitle: Subseries 9. Ottoman Empire and Middle East
Ottoman Empire, Balkans, and Middle Eastn.d.

scopecontent.p: These postcards are from several places in the Balkans, Ottoman Empire, and the Middle East. Ottoman Empire: Istanbul: panoramic views, Hagia Sofia Bosnia: Mostar, Syria: Aleppo: monastery of the praying dervishes, Afghanistan: caravan on its way to Peshawar, Pakistan, Crew of Arab ship (location unknown)

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous geography and subjects, unidentified locationsn.d.

scopecontent.p: These postcards are from a variety of inadequately identified locations. Some locations, while noted, do not fit into present geographical categories. The subjects are as follows: Map of French West Africa; fishing boats on river; harbor; colonial street scenes; Zambesi: piano and seance; cotton cultivation; street with donkeys
